docs.lead_paragraph: Her birth weight was normal. She was 10th percentile, as we say, meaning that on the female baby growth chart, the dot that represented my new patient showed her to be smaller than 90 percent of normal newborns and larger than 10 percent. Nothing worrisome about that. Every child's weight and height are traced out in curves on these charts, measured against printed parabolas that express normal weight gain -- you can grow at the 5th percentile, or at the 95th, and still be normal, as long as you grow. And at first, my patient grew nicely.

docs.lead_paragraph: REMEMBER the population bomb, the fertility explosion set to devour the world's food and suck up or pollute all its air and water? Its fuse has by no means been plucked. But over the last three decades, much of its Malthusian detonation power has leaked out. Birthrates in developed countries from Italy to Korea have sunk below the levels needed for their populations to replace themselves; the typical age of marriage and pregnancy has risen, and the use of birth control has soared beyond the dreams of Margaret Sanger and the nightmares of the Vatican.

headline.main: The World -- Subtract Billions; Demographic 'Bomb' May Only Go 'Pop!'
